AD_WorkerVignette.synopsis: | A social worker in charge of a refugee hostel is speaking with a father and his child, both of whom are seeking refuge. The social worker informs the father that, in order to prevent the spread of lice in the hostel, he must burn his child's clothes and thoroughly clean the child's hair. The social worker is concerned with maintaining order and ensuring that everyone in the hostel has a safe and clean place to stay. The family lost their mother and the father does not know how to take care of the kid properly.|
AD_WorkerVignette.how_to_trigger: Goto CTY_Main_A and goto 93 -63. Worker, Father and Child are all on the ground floor of Refugee hostel

AD_WorkerVignette_2.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
AD_WorkerVignette_2.text: No need to look so glum. You'll be clean and comfortable in no time.

AD_WorkerVignette_0.speaker: Dholber Greene
AD_WorkerVignette_0.text: I'm so embarrassed. I - I'm sorry. We must have caught them riding on the ox cart.

AD_WorkerVignette_3.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
AD_WorkerVignette_3.text: No sense apologising for what can't be helped. You made it here safely - that's what matters.

AD_WorkerVignette_6.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
AD_WorkerVignette_6.text: Rules are the same for everyone: clothes go in the fire, comb goes through the hair. We'll have no lice in here.

AD_WorkerVignette_5.speaker: Dholber Greene
AD_WorkerVignette_5.text: Burn my son's clothes? But I've nothing else for him to wear.

AD_WorkerVignette_1.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
AD_WorkerVignette_1.text: We've plenty of donations. I'm sure you'll find something that fits.

AD_WorkerVignette_4.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
AD_WorkerVignette_4.text: Hot soapy water and a fine-tooth comb - that's all you need. Those lice will be gone in no time.

AD_WorkerVignette_8.speaker: Dholber Greene
AD_WorkerVignette_8.text: His mother was better with this kind of thing... I'll do my best.
AD_WorkerVignette_8.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, sad - his wife has died

Father_0.speaker: Dholber Greene
Father_0.text: I'm grateful to be here. I am. But I thought we'd arrive as a family. Not like this...
Father_0.context: NodeContext: Putting a brave face on things, sad about his wife dying on the road

Father_1.speaker: Dholber Greene
Father_1.text: Perhaps I'll feel better after some rest. Feels like I haven't slept in a tenday.
Father_1.context: NodeContext: Putting a brave face on things, sad about his wife dying on the road

Worker_0.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
Worker_0.text: We've not much to go around, but we'll make it stretch. We always do.

Worker_1.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
Worker_1.text: Welcome. If you've need of a bunk or a bath, you'll find them upstairs.
